chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos A Hernandez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carlos A Hernandez in court.  Attorney John Scott Schiro in court for Carlos A Hernandez. Kevin Clancy, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Samuel E. Simpson for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing. All previously ordered conditions remain. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carlos A Hernandez in court.  Attorney John Scott Schiro in court for Carlos A Hernandez.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Parties are negotiating and defense counsel requests a status conference. Defense to notify the State in advance if case is going to resolve on the day of the status conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 36.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Carlos A Hernandez appeared by video.  Attorney John Scott Schiro appeared by video for Carlos A Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 36. Court orders defendant to continue to comply with Justice Point conditions.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Carlos A Hernandez in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Defendant Carlos A Hernandez in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Carlos A Hernandez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
